## Discussion

Use this constant in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/orientation] property to specify a horizontal layout for the stack view. Use it to specify the horizontal user interface axis for clipping resistance and hugging priority.

The leading, center, and trailing gravity areas in a horizontal stack view are arranged left to right or right to left depending on the value of the inherited [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/userInterfaceLayoutDirection] property.

# NSUserInterfaceLayoutOrientation.horizontal

**Case**

The horizontal orientation.

## Declaration

```swift
case horizontal
```

## Discussion

Use this constant in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/orientation] property to specify a horizontal layout for the stack view. Use it to specify the horizontal user interface axis for clipping resistance and hugging priority.

The leading, center, and trailing gravity areas in a horizontal stack view are arranged left to right or right to left depending on the value of the inherited [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/userInterfaceLayoutDirection] property.

## Constants

- **NSUserInterfaceLayoutOrientation.vertical**: The vertical orientation.
title: NSUserInterfaceLayoutOrientation.horizontal
